pull.title: test: Fixup TODO comment in feature_dbcrash.py; remove unnecessary sleep
pull.body:
Fixup some stale comments:

* The `60 seconds` is outdated. It should say 120 seconds. However, just clarify that there is a timeout.
* The TODO seems to imply that a timeout (failure to restart) can happen. However, I don't think we've seen it happen. So there isn't anything to do right now. Just remove the `TODO`, but keep the advice.

Also, remove an unnecessary `time.sleep(1)`. If there is a need for it, a comment should explain why.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | Concept ACK | [l0rinc](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34539#pullrequestreview-3773855181) | | Stale ACK | [willcl-ark](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34539#pullrequestreview-3775739273) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore.

ACK ffff716dc4271eec6de29149205c093898333a11

Looks OK to me. Left a non-blocking comment about the unused timeout.
Concept ACK, please see my measurements

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -77,7 +77,7 @@ def restart_node(self, node_index, expected_tip):
         """Start up a given node id, wait for the tip to reach the given block hash, and calculate the utxo hash.
 
         Exceptions on startup should indicate node crash (due to -dbcrashratio), in which case we try again. Give up
comments.body:
The comment explicitly states:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/fa5f29774872d18febc0df38831a6e45f3de69cc/test/functional/feature_dbcrash.py#L85

So it's also not completely accurate to claim it's only startup:

```suggestion
        Exceptions during startup or subsequent RPC calls should indicate node crash (due to -dbcrashratio), in which case we try again. Give up
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -93,12 +93,11 @@ def restart_node(self, node_index, expected_tip):
                 # should raise an exception if bitcoind doesn't exit.
                 self.wait_for_node_exit(node_index, timeout=10)
             self.crashed_on_restart += 1
-            time.sleep(1)
comments.body:
> Also, remove an unused time.sleep(1)

This seems to be a simple retry backoff between attempts, are you suggesting the startup should just succeed without any grace period and it just slows down execution? Let me check that...

---

I tried the ~disabled~extended test locally, it's is [insanely slow](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/3764746404a8f05c5937c5dec27139f312346cdd/test/functional/test_runner.py#L91) on my machine:
```python
TEST               | STATUS    | DURATION

feature_dbcrash.py | ✓ Passed  | 522 s
```
and without the sleep it may be a bit faster (or maybe it's just a fluke):
```python
TEST               | STATUS    | DURATION

feature_dbcrash.py | ✓ Passed  | 516 s
```

---

Measured it properly on an Rpi5 it's basically the same speed with or without the sleep:

<details>
<summary>2026-02-09 | functional tests | rpi5-16-2 | aarch64 | Cortex-A76 | 4 cores | 15Gi RAM</summary>

```bash
COMMITS="5f6bfa3649c3301a7c5f244450ba43e1287eb8e7 ffff716dc4271eec6de29149205c093898333a11 dd714ebaff41fb912baa4870ab1b68ae497dccec"; \
CC=gcc; CXX=g++; \
(echo ""; for c in $COMMITS; do git fetch -q origin $c && git log -1 --pretty='%h %s' $c || exit 1; done) && \
(echo "" && echo "$(date -I) | functional tests | $(hostname) | $(uname -m) | $(lscpu | grep 'Model name' | head -1 | cut -d: -f2 | xargs) | $(nproc) cores | $(free -h | awk '/^Mem:/{print $2}') RAM"; echo "") && \
hyperfine \
  --sort command \
  --runs 3 \
  --parameter-list COMMIT ${COMMITS// /,} \
  --prepare "git checkout {COMMIT} && git clean -fxd && git reset --hard && \
    cmake -B build -G Ninja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release && ninja -C build -j$(nproc)" \
  "build/test/functional/test_runner.py feature_dbcrash"
```

</details>

> 5f6bfa3649 Merge bitcoin/bitcoin#34057: test: add tests for cluster chunks
> ffff716dc4 Fixup TODO comment in feature_dbcrash.py; remove unused sleep
> dd714ebaff test: only call gettxoutsetinfo when nodei_utxo_hash is calculated

```python
Benchmark 1: build/test/functional/test_runner.py feature_dbcrash (COMMIT = 5f6bfa3649c3301a7c5f244450ba43e1287eb8e7)
  Time (mean ± σ):     2829.872 s ± 33.415 s    [User: 2796.205 s, System: 87.889 s]
  Range (min … max):   2792.286 s … 2856.218 s    3 runs

Benchmark 2: build/test/functional/test_runner.py feature_dbcrash (COMMIT = ffff716dc4271eec6de29149205c093898333a11)
  Time (mean ± σ):     2832.783 s ±  8.394 s    [User: 2824.483 s, System: 88.198 s]
  Range (min … max):   2823.098 s … 2837.963 s    3 runs

Benchmark 3: build/test/functional/test_runner.py feature_dbcrash (COMMIT = dd714ebaff41fb912baa4870ab1b68ae497dccec)
  Time (mean ± σ):     2794.477 s ± 57.106 s    [User: 2765.743 s, System: 87.325 s]
  Range (min … max):   2730.499 s … 2840.294 s    3 runs
```

<details>
<summary>only call gettxoutsetinfo when nodei_utxo_hash is calculated</summary>

```patch
diff --git a/test/functional/feature_dbcrash.py b/test/functional/feature_dbcrash.py
--- a/test/functional/feature_dbcrash.py	(revision 5f6bfa3649c3301a7c5f244450ba43e1287eb8e7)
+++ b/test/functional/feature_dbcrash.py	(revision dd714ebaff41fb912baa4870ab1b68ae497dccec)
@@ -130,7 +130,7 @@
         If any nodes crash while updating, we'll compare utxo hashes to
         ensure recovery was successful."""
 
-        node3_utxo_hash = self.nodes[3].gettxoutsetinfo()['hash_serialized_3']
+        node3_utxo_hash = None
 
         # Retrieve all the blocks from node3
         blocks = []
@@ -165,6 +165,8 @@
             # - we only update the utxo cache after a node restart, since flushing
             # the cache is a no-op at that point
             if nodei_utxo_hash is not None:
+                if node3_utxo_hash is None:
+                    node3_utxo_hash = self.nodes[3].gettxoutsetinfo()['hash_serialized_3']
                 self.log.debug(f"Checking txoutsetinfo matches for node {i}")
                 assert_equal(nodei_utxo_hash, node3_utxo_hash)
```

</details>

---

```patch
diff --git a/test/functional/feature_dbcrash.py b/test/functional/feature_dbcrash.py
--- a/test/functional/feature_dbcrash.py	(revision dcc66439dd549d49af814a2560b9733aedd9b695)
+++ b/test/functional/feature_dbcrash.py	(date 1770714020785)
@@ -93,7 +93,7 @@
                 # should raise an exception if bitcoind doesn't exit.
                 self.wait_for_node_exit(node_index, timeout=10)
             self.crashed_on_restart += 1
-            time.sleep(1)
+            raise Exception("time.sleep(1)")
 
         # If we got here, bitcoind isn't coming back up on restart.  Could be a
         # bug in bitcoind, or we've gotten unlucky with our dbcrash ratio --
```
indicates the sleep is not "unused" just possibly "unnecessary", if you reword that, I'm happy to ack.
<details>
<summary>exception</summary>

```python
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/lorinc/CLionProjects/bitcoin/test/functional/test_framework/test_framework.py", line 142, in main
    self.run_test()
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^
  File "/Users/lorinc/CLionProjects/bitcoin/build/test/functional/feature_dbcrash.py", line 263, in run_test
    self.sync_node3blocks(block_hashes)
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/Users/lorinc/CLionProjects/bitcoin/build/test/functional/feature_dbcrash.py", line 152, in sync_node3blocks
    nodei_utxo_hash = self.restart_node(i, block_hash)
  File "/Users/lorinc/CLionProjects/bitcoin/build/test/functional/feature_dbcrash.py", line 96, in restart_node
    raise Exception("time.sleep(1)")
Exception: time.sleep(1)
```

</details>

Also, please consider the `gettxoutsetinfo` patch above, it ain' much but at least it's measurable.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -93,12 +93,11 @@ def restart_node(self, node_index, expected_tip):
                 # should raise an exception if bitcoind doesn't exit.
                 self.wait_for_node_exit(node_index, timeout=10)
             self.crashed_on_restart += 1
-            time.sleep(1)
comments.body:
As this is inside the loop I did wonder if we might get into a tight restart loop without it. But the crash can only happen during a flush (not during startup), which takes _some_ time on restart+recovery. With -dbcache=4 and -dbcrashratio=8 it's not obvious this always takes more than a second. Previously the sleep was bounding us to at most <120 restarts...

Anyway, I think it's OK for a test, and OK as you suggest to revert (and comment) it if necessary.

                 # should raise an exception if bitcoind doesn't exit.
                 self.wait_for_node_exit(node_index, timeout=10)

-            time.sleep(1)
comments.body:

thx, done.



> Also, please consider the `gettxoutsetinfo` patch above, it ain' much but at least it's measurable.

I don't think it is measurable. The error bars overlap with the mean
